snippet: The decision, which requires government approval, would provide a much-needed logistics hub at a time when overland supply routes through Pakistan have been closed off.
abstract: Kremlin expresses willingness to allow NATO to use an airfield in the heart of European Russia as a transit center for moving troops and 'nonlethal' cargo into Afghanistan; decision, which requires formal government approval, would provide a much-needed logistics hub at a time when overland supply routes through Pakistan have been closed off.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The decision, which requires government approval, would provide a much-needed logistics hub at a time when overland supply routes through Pakistan have been closed off.

headline.seo: Kremlin Willing to Let NATO Use Airfield for Afghan Transit
headline.main: Russia May Let NATO Use Airfield as Afghan Hub
headline.print_headline: Russia May Let NATO Use Airfield as Afghan Hub
